results.title: The Railway station = La Stazione
results.brief_description: Flavia, a rich and beautiful young society woman flees from an outlandish party, when she discovers her presence there served only to secure a business deal for her violent over-bearing lover Danilo. Attempting to leave her predicament on the first available train, Flavia seeks refuge in a small railway station where she meets Domenico, a shy and modest station-master who offers her both moral support and shelter from the impending storm. While spending the night together awaiting the arrival of the morning train, the pair become hopelessly drawn to each other despite their apparent class differences. In Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: The Railway men
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Transport and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: One of a series of films about work and conditions, designed as vocational guidance films. Tells the story of the men who work on Britain’s network of railways.

results.title: The Railrodder
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Gerald Potterton
results.brief_description: A humorous trip across Canada from the Atlantic to the Pacific with Buster Keaton riding on a rail “trike” which contains everything he needs in the way of food, clothing, tools, bedding, shaving gear, and even a rifle. This is Buster Keaton’s last film, made by the National Film Board before he died. It is a travelogue with a difference.

results.title: The Raft of the Medusa: five voices on colonies, nations and histories
results.brief_description: Canadian documentary filmmaker Julian Samuel presents an intellectual discourse on world history from the birth of civilization to modern day with particular focus on the Orient. In order to maintain a balanced non-European perspective, analytical interviews are conducted with Amin Maalouf (writer - ‘Leon L’African’), Thierry Hentsch (specialist, international relations - ‘Imagining the Middle East’), Nourbese Philip (writer/critic - ‘Looking for Livingstone’, ‘Frontiers’), Sara Suleri (writer/critic - ‘The Rhetoric of English India’) and Ackbar Abbas (critic - commentator on Walter Benjamin and Hong Kong cinema). This excellent and informative program covers social, economical, political, cultural and religious issues including colonialism and imperialism; capitalism and communism; European, African and Asian histories; East/West relations; fundamentalism and secularism; and major historical events such as the partition of India in 1947, the political separation of Hong Kong from China in 1949 and Hong Kong’s future with the ending of British rule by 1997, the emancipation of slaves, Occidental modernism and the rise of Islamic fundamentalism. Contains some b&w archival footage. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Radical Poets
results.creator_credit: Peter Lane, Ken Smeaton and Terrence Doran
results.brief_description: The Punters Club Hotel, Fitzroy. These are committed poets of the eighties who wish to take their poetry to the people. They confront, they amuse, they berate, they seduce, they delight in the powerful and poetic use of words, rhythms and aural imagery. They challenge one’s perception and evoke moments of wonder, at a phrase, a rhythm or a point of view. Theirs is the poetry of anger, of love, of deprivation, of desire to see.

results.title: The Races
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia, Kit Denton, John Shaw and Daro Gunzberg
results.brief_description: A compilation of three racing films: “A Race of Horses”, “Pace” and “Kew Howard, Saddler”. See strappers, handlers, trainers, jockeys and vets in action and hear one of Australia’s last saddlers reminisce about his craft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Murray, Film Australia, Kit Denton, John Shaw and Daro Gunzberg

results.title: The Race for space
results.creator_credit: Wolper Productions and David L. Wolper
results.brief_description: A history of efforts to reach out into space, the development of rockets and the space race between USSR and the USA. The work of the Russian mathematician Konstantin Tsiolkovsky in 1930, Dr Robert Godard, an American in 1913, and the early experiments of the German Rocket Society. Hitler and the development of the V2. The capture of German scientists by American and Russian troops and the subsequent developments leading to the launching of Satellites Sputnik I and II. Early American mistakes with the Vanguard Rocket and their final success with Explorer I some months after the Russians.

results.title: The RAAF aircraft apprentice scheme
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Shows opportunities for boys to take up trades in the RAAF. They begin a 5 year course at Wagga (NSW). Then according to aptitude and ambition, they go on to learn care and repair of ground transport, aero engines, aircraft, armaments, radio and electronic equipment. The film stresses the chances for a full life in training, higher study and promotion.

results.title: The Quinkins
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Paul R. Gagne
results.brief_description: A group of Aborigines combined their talents to create the pictures and sound for this traditional tale of conflict between the Imnims and the Timaras in Dreamtime. Uses the illustrations from the book of the same name by Dick Roughsey and Percy Trezise.
